snippet.textDisplay:
Reviews shouldn't have numbers at all.  You can't quantify things like that.

I personally loved Bastion, but I can understand why some people wouldn't enjoy certain elements of it.  Though I've met some people who weren't fond of the narration and I can't understand that... I could listen to Rucks all day...
snippet.textOriginal:
Reviews shouldn't have numbers at all.  You can't quantify things like that.

I personally loved Bastion, but I can understand why some people wouldn't enjoy certain elements of it.  Though I've met some people who weren't fond of the narration and I can't understand that... I could listen to Rucks all day...

snippet.textDisplay: You do learn some things though
snippet.textOriginal: You do learn some things though

snippet.textDisplay: i only wish to have learned a little more about Rucks

snippet.textDisplay: The thing that made the game for me is that the player learned what zia and zulf's life was before the calamity. The Who knows where, part was the best part of a game I had experienced in a while. My rating for this game is 9/10.
snippet.textOriginal: The thing that made the game for me is that the player learned what zia and zulf's life was before the calamity. The Who knows where, part was the best part of a game I had experienced in a while. My rating for this game is 9/10.

snippet.textDisplay: Few times I will disagree with Supra.  This game just screams greatness and it's no wonder it's won and has been winning awards for a reason.  This really is the best $15 I ever spent on a video game.  Hell, just the 1 ending choice alone makes the game worth it.  Great combat, story, music.  Few games I'd ever rate a 10/10.
snippet.textOriginal: Few times I will disagree with Supra.  This game just screams greatness and it's no wonder it's won and has been winning awards for a reason.  This really is the best $15 I ever spent on a video game.  Hell, just the 1 ending choice alone makes the game worth it.  Great combat, story, music.  Few games I'd ever rate a 10/10.

snippet.textDisplay: to be honest the only real problem with this game is the story is so good that the 4hr play time is a real "insult" other then that this game deserves any an all praise it gets and its a must buy among indie games released last year i paid full price (14.99 i think) and what i got at that price i honestly felt like i was stealing the game was that good

snippet.textDisplay: Pretty much the best song on the album/in the game. Hands down. Great end theme. I feel the same about the style over substance. I felt they had a good game, but as an indie game goes, it's friggen amazing. Wished they took it further than what it was. 6.5 is a shameful score in comparison to some of the other indie games that were released around the same time as Bastion too, which it probably why it easily took Indie GOTY. No competition on the soundtrack though, one of the best I've heard :)
snippet.textOriginal: Pretty much the best song on the album/in the game. Hands down. Great end theme. I feel the same about the style over substance. I felt they had a good game, but as an indie game goes, it's friggen amazing. Wished they took it further than what it was. 6.5 is a shameful score in comparison to some of the other indie games that were released around the same time as Bastion too, which it probably why it easily took Indie GOTY. No competition on the soundtrack though, one of the best I've heard :)

snippet.textDisplay:
"Awesome combat, graphics and music. The rest? I wasn't a very big fan of." 

So you mean to say you liked all of it?
snippet.textOriginal:
"Awesome combat, graphics and music. The rest? I wasn't a very big fan of."

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Sums up my thoughts perfectly. Not just for this but a whole lot of the undiscovered games genre. They're all really good, but just because it's slick, artsy, different graphical style, and odd music, doesn't mean it's the greatest game ever. I'd give GOTY to Zelda SS myself. If not for being a massive, deep, and brilliant Zelda game, then for doing what the gaming industry has been attempting for almost over 20 years...motion gaming done right.
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky Sums up my thoughts perfectly. Not just for this but a whole lot of the undiscovered games genre. They're all really good, but just because it's slick, artsy, different graphical style, and odd music, doesn't mean it's the greatest game ever. I'd give GOTY to Zelda SS myself. If not for being a massive, deep, and brilliant Zelda game, then for doing what the gaming industry has been attempting for almost over 20 years...motion gaming done right.

snippet.textDisplay: A nice indie game with awesome combat, graphics and music. The rest? I wasn't a very big fan of. Most people will disagree with me (it's getting a lot of Indie GOTY), but I just found the game had the "style over substance" problem. It felt like a great tech demo for something that could be truly amazing, a big RPG without those isolated labyrinths made of corridors and very basic puzzles. Destructoid's review is pretty much dead on for me, though I wouldn't go as low as giving it 6.5.
snippet.textOriginal: A nice indie game with awesome combat, graphics and music. The rest? I wasn't a very big fan of. Most people will disagree with me (it's getting a lot of Indie GOTY), but I just found the game had the "style over substance" problem. It felt like a great tech demo for something that could be truly amazing, a big RPG without those isolated labyrinths made of corridors and very basic puzzles. Destructoid's review is pretty much dead on for me, though I wouldn't go as low as giving it 6.5.
